Class Gameboard

    • Field Summary

      Two dimensional array of Field objects, describing the game board.
      static int BOARD_SIZE
      The number of fields in a row or column.
      private int movableTiles
      The number of tiles that were placed on the board in the current turn.

    • Method Detail

      • setTile

        public boolean setTile(int row,
                       int col,
                       int code)
        If it is possible, places a tile at the given position on the board, with a given tile code. If the tile is a joker, use the setJokerTile method instead.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index where the tile should be placed
        col - the column index where the tile should be placed
        code - the code of the tile
        Returns:
        true if the tile has been successfully placed on the board, false otherwise

      • setJokerTile

        public boolean setJokerTile(int row,
                            int col,
                            int code)
        If it is possible, places a joker at the given position, replacing the given tile code.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index where the tile should be placed
        col - the column index where the tile should be placed
        code - the code of the tile that is replaced by the joker
        Returns:
        true if the tile has been successfully placed on the board, false otherwise

      • pickUpTile

        public int pickUpTile(int row,
                      int col)
        Returns the tile code of the field with the given row and column indices, if the tile is movable, regarding the rules, and sets its value to Field.NOTILE.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index from where the tile should be removed
        col - the column index from where the tile should be removed
        Returns:
        the tile code of the tile picked up, or the Field.NOTILE constant if there was no tile on the field

      • isLegal

        public boolean isLegal(boolean firstTurn)
        Checks if the disposal of the tiles on the board allows the player to end his turn, regarding the rules. The method needs to know that the game is in the first turn, or not, because that is a special case.
        Parameters:
        firstTurn - true if the game is in the first turn
        Returns:
        true if the state of the board matches the above condition, false otherwise

      • readRowWord

        private String readRowWord(int row,
                           int col)
        Reads a word horizontally, starting from the given position. It is called by the public method getPlayedWords.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index of the starting position
        col - the column index of the starting position
        Returns:
        the word read, or null if there is no tile on the starting position

      • readColWord

        private String readColWord(int row,
                           int col)
        Reads a word vertically, starting from the given position. It is called by the public method getPlayedWords.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index of the starting position
        col - the column index of the starting position
        Returns:
        the word read, or null if there is no tile on the starting position

      • getPlayedWords

        public List<String> getPlayedWords()
        Returns a list of the words played in the current turn. The method assumes that the state of the board allows the player to end his turn regarding the rules, i.e. the isLegal method returns true, otherwise the return value will be undefined.
        Returns:
        a list of strings containing the words played in the current turn, or null if there were no words played in the current turn

      • calcRowWordPts

        private int calcRowWordPts(int row,
                           int col)
        Calculates the value in points of a word placed horizontally and including the given position. This method is used by the public calcPoints() method.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index of the starting position of the word
        col - the column index of the starting position of the word
        Returns:
        the value of the word in points

      • calcColWordPts

        private int calcColWordPts(int row,
                           int col)
        Calculates the value in points of a word placed vertically and including the given position. This method is used by the public calcPoints() method.
        Parameters:
        row - the row index of the starting position of the word
        col - the column index of the starting position of the word
        Returns:
        the value of the word in points

      • calcPoints

        public int calcPoints()
        Returns the number of points the player will get in the current turn, based on the current state of the board. The method assumes that the state of the board allows the player to end his turn regarding the rules, i.e. the isLegal() method returns true, otherwise the return value will be undefined.
        Returns:
        the total number of points gained in the current turn, or undefined value if the isLegal() method returns false

      • getFields

        public Field[][] getFields()
        Returns the two dimensional array representing the fields of the board
        Returns:
        a two dimensional array of Field objects

      • getRowLetters

        public String getRowLetters(int row)

      • getMovableTiles

        public int getMovableTiles()
        Returns:
        the movableTiles

      • wordsAreCorrect

        public boolean wordsAreCorrect(Dictionary dict)
        Checks if the tiles placed on the board in the current turn form grammatically correct words. If there are no such tiles, the method will return false. The method receives a Dictionary object with the words considered correct.
        Parameters:
        dict - the Dictionary object
        Returns:
        true if all the words placed on the board in the current turn are correct, false if there are no tiles placed on the board in the current turn, or there is at least one grammatically incorrect word.

      • finalizeFields

        public void finalizeFields()
